task.title: Editing XML schema properties
task.shortdesc: After you create an XML schema, you can edit its various properties, such as its namespace and prefix.

context.p: The following instructions were written for the Resource perspective, but they will also work in many other perspectives.
To edit an XML schema's properties, complete the following steps:

step.cmd: Create a new XML schema or double-click an existing schema in the Navigator view.
step.info: It will automatically open in the XML schema editor.

step.cmd: In the Outline view, click Directives.
In the Properties view, click the General tab.
You can change the Prefix associated with the current namespace.
step.info: Element and attribute names that are associated with this namespace will be prefixed with this value.

step.cmd: You can also edit the Target namespace for this schema.
step.info: A namespace is a URI that provides a unique name to associate with all the elements and type definitions in a schema.

step.cmd: Click the Documentation tab if you want to provide any information about this XML schema.
step.info: The Documentation page is used for human readable material, such as a description.

step.cmd: Click the Extensions tab if you want to add application information elements to your annotations of schema components.
step.info: The Extensions page allows you to specify the schema and add XML content to your annotations.
